jam.global
Interface Sorter

All Known Implementing Classes:
SortRoutine
public interface Sorter

Interface for user-written sort classes. User writes a sort class which must have the following methods:

initialize
called when the sort process is initialized
sort
called for each event
monitor
called each time the monitors are updated

Since:
JDK 1.1
Version:
0.9
Author:
Ken Swartz

Method Summary
 void initialize()
          Initializes all variables and process states to be ready to begin sorting.
 double monitor(java.lang.String name)
          Updates any monitors.
 void sort(int[] dataWords)
          Called to process each event.
 

Method Detail

initialize

public void initialize()
                throws java.lang.Exception
Initializes all variables and process states to be ready to begin sorting. Should be called prior to any calls to sort.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - any exceptions caught by calls in this method should be thrown up to the controlling thread

sort

public void sort(int[] dataWords)
          throws java.lang.Exception
Called to process each event. The sort method looks at gates and increments histograms.
Parameters:
dataWords - event passed as an int array for speed
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - any exceptions caught by calls in this method should be thrown up to the controlling thread

monitor

public double monitor(java.lang.String name)
Updates any monitors.
Parameters:
name - name of monitor value to calculate
Returns:
current value for monitor window to display
See Also:
Monitor
